text:
If a folder that contains header.html but does not have a valid index page is 
requested while the Indexes option is enabled, the header.html is used in 
place of the "Index of <PATH>" header.

This appears to only occur on the Windows version of Apache 2.0.48 and not the 
Linux version.

The Windows version used was the pre-built 2.0.48 MSI and the Linux version 
was a custom source install. Proof of this bug is not able to be provided by 
myself at this time as I do not have a Windows box available online.
creator: clehardy@betablue.net

text:
Ok, I have a few corrections.

1) I've gotten this bug to work on a Linux server now, so I've marked the OS 
as All.
2) The file that needs to be in the folder appears to be HEADER.html (notice 
the caps). This had not been noticed by myself earlier due to Windows not 
making the case distinction that Linux does.

An example is located at: http://gideon.theenvoygroup.net/apachegroup/. Also, 
this bug has been seen by myself in version 2.0.47 of the Windows build, but I 
have not had a chance to test it with other versions.

Lastly, in a quick test on Apache 1.3.27, this bug does not occur on that 
version (a custom RPM build was used on Linux).
creator: clehardy@betablue.net

text:
This is a feature, not a bug.  See:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_autoindex.html#headername

And please try the users mailing list before submitting a bug
report.

Thanks.
creator: slive@apache.org
